item.title: Affordable Off-The-Shelf Augmented Reality in Python
item.dc:creator: Thomas Perl

item.title: Facial Analysis Techniques for Pythonista (and beyond!)
item.description:
Description

The ability to detect, track, and analyze faces opens up a wide range of interesting use cases, ranging from interactive smart applications and real- time video processing, all the way to biometric security and augmented reality.

This talk will showcase the available tools built by the Python community and their corresponding pros & cons, limitations, and complexity. While discussing the possible scenarios and what is actually required to DIY with Python, I will compare such handmade solutions with Cloud-based products and APIs.

Prerequisites: basic understanding of Pythonâ€™s data science stack (especially numpy).
item.dc:creator: Alex Casalboni

item.title: Detectron2 - Next Gen Object Detection Library
item.description:
Description

Object detection and segmentation are used for tasks ranging from autonomous vehicles to content understanding for platform integrity. Learn about Detectron2, an object detection library now implemented in PyTorch. Detectron2 provides support for the latest models and tasks, increased flexibility to aid computer vision research, and improvements in maintainability and scalability to support production use cases.
item.dc:creator: Yuxin Wu
